title: BinanceBobber
author: BinanceBobber
content: Hi,I want to purchase some alt coins. I have some Bitcoin on Binance that I plan to move over to my Trezor. I see people talk a lot about smaller cap coins that is not on Binance. What exchange has the best meme and alt coins out there? Where can I check the exchanges with most alt coins?Thank you in advance

comments.author: masulum
comments.body: The most frequently listed meme tokens are:- Gate.io- BitMart- XT- Probit- MEXC- HOTBITBut, if you really don't want to register on a new exchange, you can use the telegram bot https://t.me/BSC_Price_BOT for BSC tokens, from there you can get lots of new tokens and listed on Pancakeswap. But, buying new tokens is more risky, it can even become a scam in minutes. DYOR/DWYOR

comments.author: Maidak
comments.body: The best way is to go to coinmarketcap and search for the altcoins you want to buy. You will find information about which exchange it is listed on as well as other essential information. But investing in altcoins or shitcoins is very risky, you should consider carefully and research yourself before investing, and don't listen to anyone's advice to invest. And it should be emphasized that you just did the right thing; you did not put crypto assets on a centralized exchange.

comments.author: kojektea
comments.body: Many cryptocurrency exchanges have a large number of alt coins (cryptocurrencies other than Bitcoin) available for trading. Binance is one of the popular exchanges that has a lot of alt coins, but there are also other exchanges that offer a large number of alt coins, such as Coinbase, Kraken, and Bittrex.To find an exchange with most alt coins, you can use websites such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko, which provide a list of various alt coins available on various exchanges. You can also check directly with specific exchanges to see the full list of available alt coins.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: BinanceBobber on December 16, 2022, 01:14:33 PMHi,I want to purchase some alt coins. I have some Bitcoin on Binance that I plan to move over to my Trezor. I see people talk a lot about smaller cap coins that is not on Binance. What exchange has the best meme and alt coins out there? Where can I check the exchanges with most alt coins?Thank you in advanceThere are many exchange platforms in which you will find thousands of altcoins and meme coins, but you should have experience in determining these currencies that you will invest in, and through CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko you can find the markets through which the currency is traded, through my experience I see that the best exchange platforms For meme coins, it is Gate.io. As for most altcoins, they are KuCoin and Coinbase, Kraken, and Bybit. You can read the advantages and disadvantages of each exchange platform and all the details about them, and then determine which platforms you will choose.My advice to you is to stay away from meme coins, as they have no value and carry huge risks.

comments.author: Bobrox
comments.body: Not good financial advice when investing with shit altcoin and you want move Bitcoin to purchase several altcoin, I don't think have good ideas leaving  Bitcoin investment in Binance and you want to buy several shit altcoin. Many altcoin have been drop drastically and several upgrade smart contract address and our old coins loss or have lower values. But if excited with shit altcoin you can purchase in Hotbit, MEXC or Pancake Swap have many new shit altcoin listed every time, but can't guarantee with shit coins exist in long period in exchange market because when upgrade smart contract and price drop drastically many exchange delist shit coin.

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: This is the best crypto exchange in my opinion and it's just a friendly suggestion, and it's up to you whether you will believe me or not because I'm not the expert.You can check the following exchanges:CapitalWalletBitMartKrakenGeminiKuCoinCoinbaseThey have a wide range of altcoins and they are safe too.

comments.author: samcrypto
comments.body: They are spread out on many exchanges, better to look for their total market cap instead and analyze their project, to know this easily you can just look at the coinmarketcap, where you can search new projects as well. If you are planning to hold altcoins for long term then I can only suggest top altcoins but if you are just going to trade with it, just look for an altcoin with a great volume everyday.

comments.author: Sayeds56
comments.body: I think best exchange for buying any coin or token is Binance, where majority of digital assets is listed, trading fee is reasonable and liquidity is not an issue. Having said that, I would suggest you to continue holding your Bitcoin which is most precious & secure crypto currency, though currently its price almost 80% down from its ATH price but as predicted by many prominent market analysts, it might hit $100K in the next bull run which is likely to happen in 2024.

comments.author: o48o
comments.created_time: December 16, 2022, 05:43:51 PMLast edit: December 16, 2022, 09:20:19 PM by o48o
comments.body: Quote from: Maidak on December 16, 2022, 02:01:06 PMThe best way is to go to coinmarketcap and search for the altcoins you want to buy. You will find information about which exchange it is listed on as well as other essential information.-cut-This is a good advice, and there also are some tokens that are not listed yet but they are trading in uniswap, pankaceswap and there are several buy opportunities on launchpads our there. But you need to do some digging on those and double check that you are buying a token with a correct contract address becuse there are ton of scammers and phishers out there giving you a wrong one.

comments.author: CryptoYar
comments.body: Quote from: BinanceBobber on December 16, 2022, 01:14:33 PMWhat exchange has the best meme and alt coins out there? Can't say from which exchange will get you the best meme tokens. ( I'm not a fan of these tokens)But for best altcoins, kucoin exchange is best IMO.Many such projects in the last bull market were listed only on the kucoin Exchange but later they got listed on binance as well. I still recall some of these project's names. Dego, flow, kadena... I'm not saying, all altcoins listed on kucoin are good projects, yes there are some garbage too. You gotta spend some time to find a gem.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: When people say Exchanges like Binance I see lots of confidence in their statements many of them just thinks so long Binance is a big exchange this automatically makes it the best option for them, but the truth they should be more concern about is not how big the exchange is because even big exchanges has had their loss.I would rather newbies and less experienced people concern themselves more of how decentralized an exchange is and focus more on that. So if you can do your research and find out decentralized exchanges which has list of Altcoins of your choice.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Here you, for centralized exchanges, come up with this whole list: (https://coinmarketcap.com/rankings/exchanges/)For decentralized exchanges then, here's your list: (https://coinmarketcap.com/rankings/exchanges/dex/)

comments.author: mdzahed134
comments.body: Quote from: BinanceBobber on December 16, 2022, 01:14:33 PMWhat exchange has the best meme and alt coins out there? Where can I check the exchanges with most alt coins?I know about several exchanges those are well known for the meme coins specially as like Latoken, Probit, Coinsbit, Bitforex here you will get thousands of meme/shit coins, you can go to check out Coinmarketcap or Coingecko to find such exchanges. On the other hand tons of meme coins on the PancakeSwap and UniSwap.

comments.author: Jackl87
comments.body: Quote from: BinanceBobber on December 16, 2022, 01:14:33 PMHi,I want to purchase some alt coins. I have some Bitcoin on Binance that I plan to move over to my Trezor. I see people talk a lot about smaller cap coins that is not on Binance. What exchange has the best meme and alt coins out there? Where can I check the exchanges with most alt coins?Thank you in advanceIf you want to use a centralized exchange for your trading then maybe you can try Kucoin. They have a lot of coins listed and a lot of trading pair supported and they are among the top crypto exchanges out there and they have also recently published their exchange reserve data so they are pretty transparent about their holdings in this chaotic times.That being said if you want to trade meme-coins then you should probably use uniswap or pancakeswap because most of those meme-coins get never listed on the big exchanges. That is also the reason why i would suggest to never touch those stupid meme-coins. They have zero use-case and 99% of them are dead again within a few weeks.

comments.author: Flexystar
comments.body: Though not advisable to get involved with low cap or high cap alts you can always consider buying the alts with PoW technology behind them. We get lot of assurance from the network considering there are hundreds thousands of miners around the globe working to mine that particular coin and this trying to make their way up to keep getting more coins. Such alts are best investment, we always have security of market depth as well as we know very well that miners got our back. Somehow they look safe to me. You can filter this over CMC and analyse to invest.

comments.author: cryptops.exchange
comments.created_time: December 16, 2022, 07:57:46 PMLast edit: December 16, 2022, 08:13:09 PM by cryptops.exchange
comments.body: I am biased of course, but an alternative I have not seen mentioned yet would be to avoid the hassle of needing to use third party arbiter exchanges and find projects that offer direct BTC blockchain to blockchain bridges that offer ICO price increases. This could be more convenient and decrease overall risk exposure. A project that can at least explain how it is going to earn a return for their hodlers and have proof of some implementation may be a good idea in these financially troubling times. Of course as others mentioned DYOR/DWYOR.

comments.author: Bitstar_coin
comments.body: Binance is my recommendation, the exchange is very user-friendly and accepts many local currencies, unlike other exchanges that are limited.     You can always use a centralized exchange to buy your favorite coin provided you withdraw the coins from the exchange to your personal wallet.

comments.author: DoublerHunter
comments.body: Quote from: BinanceBobber on December 16, 2022, 01:14:33 PMHi,I want to purchase some alt coins. I have some Bitcoin on Binance that I plan to move over to my Trezor. I see people talk a lot about smaller cap coins that is not on Binance. What exchange has the best meme and alt coins out there? Where can I check the exchanges with most alt coins?Thank you in advance^Move it now, what are you waiting for?Move your BTC and sell your altcoins to BTC, that is the perfect plan for you. Never hold these meme coins in your wallet because they are not worth it to hold for a long period of time. It is already mentioned above, it is on coinmarketcap.com and you will search there for the exchange and the coins that you are looking for, every coin has an option of which exchange do you wanted it to trade. For trading, nothing is good other than Binance, this exchange becomes a leading exchange that you will commonly hear about here, you are safe on that exchange but never hold your coins there, after a session of trading just withdraw all your fund and keep them in your wallet. Always have your own study and don't rely on other's opinions.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Quote from: Bitstar_coin on December 16, 2022, 08:35:42 PMBinance is my recommendation, the exchange is very user-friendly and accepts many local currencies, unlike other exchanges that are limited.     You can always use a centralized exchange to buy your favorite coin provided you withdraw the coins from the exchange to your personal wallet.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                OP is looking for an altcoin that is not listed on Binance, a possible altcoins that will pump unexpectedly which I think is really hard to find. You can use small exchange or even DEX for this one because usually those potential token started from a small exchanges first and when they finally have the opportunity to rise, they will grab it. Just be careful with the small tokens though, they usually ended up as a scam token so choose wisely.
